intro: Pedicularis dhurensis, commonly known as the Himalayan lousewort, is a flowering plant native to the high altitudes of the Himalayas. It belongs to the family Orobanchaceae, which includes parasitic and hemiparasitic plants. The plant is characterized by its erect, hairy stems and clusters of small, showy flowers that range in color from pink to red. It typically grows in rocky or alpine environments, thriving in cool, moist conditions. Due to its limited distribution and specialized habitat, Pedicularis dhurensis is considered a rare and ecologically significant species.
